info.title: Solar Performance Insight API
info.description:
The backend RESTful API for Solar Performance Insight.

# Introduction

On this page, you'll find documentation for the Solar Performance
Insight API.  The API primarily serves the Solar Performance Insight
dashboard, but power users may interact with it directly. An OpenAPI
generator such as
[https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator](https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator)
may be used to generate client libraries for a number of languages to
interact with the API. A download link for the OpenAPI spec can be
found above.

# Authentication

The API is secured via OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect with
[Auth0](https://auth0.com) as the identity provider. We require valid
JSON Web Token (JWT) from Auth0 to be included as a Bearer token in
the Authorization header for API access. When [requesting a
token](https://auth0.com/docs/api/authentication#authorization-code-flow-with-pkce46),
the audience must be set to `https://app.solarperformanceinsight.org/api`, the Client ID must be set to
`G7Cag1LvitX0sOUOrYz03xv6xyl3bE9s`, and the token endpoint is `https://solarperformanceinsight.us.auth0.com/`.  Most tokens
are set to expire in 3 hours, and Auth0 rate limits requests, so users
are advised to reuse a token for as long as it is valid. One Python
library that can automatically refresh the tokens is
[Authlib](https://docs.authlib.org/en/latest/client/oauth2.html#oauth2session-for-password).

200.description: Return the data as an Apache Arrow file or a CSV.

204.description: Data object exists but no data has been uploaded.

schema.title: Response List Job Results Jobs  Job Id  Results Get

200.description: Return the job result as an Apache Arrow file or a CSV. If an error occured, this will always return application/json with further details.

AOIModelEnum.title: AOIModelEnum

AirmassModelEnum.title: AirmassModelEnum
AirmassModelEnum.description: Model to estimate relative airmass at sea level

file.title: File
file.description: A single file in CSV format or Apache Arrow file format (default). Specify the Content-Type of the file as either 'text/csv' or 'application/vnd.apache.arrow.file' as appropriate. Files with a Content-Type of 'application/octet-stream' (curl default) will be parsed as if they are Apache Arrow files.

CompareExpectedActualJobParameters.description: Calculate and compare expected to actual performance

CompareMonthlyPredictedActualJobParamete.title: CompareMonthlyPredictedActualJobParameters
CompareMonthlyPredictedActualJobParamete.description:
Compare predicted to actual performance on a monthly time
scale. Data is expected to be at the system level and include
monthly insolation, energy, and average daylight temperature.

number_of_expected_rows.title: Number Of Expected Rows
number_of_expected_rows.description: Number of total rows expected in the data upload.

number_of_extra_rows.title: Number Of Extra Rows
number_of_extra_rows.description: Number of rows outside the specified time parameters for the job.

number_of_missing_rows.title: Number Of Missing Rows
number_of_missing_rows.description: Number of rows that were missing but expected in the upload.

extra_times.title: Extra Times
extra_times.description: Times that were included in the upload but are outside the job time parameters.

missing_times.title: Missing Times
missing_times.description: Times that were expected based on the job time parameters but missing from the upload.

number_of_missing_values.title: Number Of Missing Values
number_of_missing_values.description: Number of values in each column that were missing upon upload. Does not include whole rows that were missing.

uploaded.title: Uploaded
uploaded.description: Most common period of the uploaded data

IrradianceTypeEnum.title: IrradianceTypeEnum
IrradianceTypeEnum.description: Type of irradiance included in weather files

schema_path.title: Schema Path
schema_path.description: Relative to PV system definition, i.e. /inverters/0/arrays/0

present.title: Present
present.description: If the data has been uploaded or not

data_columns.title: Data Columns
data_columns.description: Column names the data is expected to have

type.description:
Type of data in this result:
- performance data: AC performance data at the level (system or inverter) given by
  schema_path. Data has columns are time and performance.
- weather data: Modeled weather/environment data for the array given in schema_path.
  Data has columns time, global plane-of-array irradiance (poa_global), and
  cell temperature.
- monthly summary: Monthly total energy (Wh), plane of array insolation (Wh/m^2),
  effective insolation (Wh/m^2), and average daytime cell temperature.
- actual vs expected energy: Monthly totals of actual energy (Wh), expected energy (Wh),
  the difference (actual - expected) (Wh), and the ratio of actual / expected.
- daytime flag: boolean, 1 if the timestamp is day-time defined as the when the
  solar zenith for the midpoint of the interval is < 87.0 degrees.
- error message: The result could not be computed. The result for this object will
  be a JSON object describing the error.

schema_path.title: Schema Path
schema_path.description: Relative to PV system definition, i.e. /inverters/0/arrays/0

status.description:
Status of the job:
- incomplete: The job has been created but missing required data.
- prepared: The job has been created and all required data is present.
- queued: The job has been queued for execution.
- running: The job is running.
- complete: The job has completed without fatal errors and results are ready.
- error: The job encountered a fatal error. The results will describe the error.

JobTimeindex.title: JobTimeindex

start.title: Start
start.description: Start of the time range that data will be uploaded for. String values in the format YYYY-MM-DD[T]HH:MM:SS[Z or +-HH[:]MM] may be provided. Integers/floats may be provided and are assumed to be Unix time.

end.title: End
end.description: End (exclusive) of the time range that data will be uploaded for

step.title: Step
step.description: Time step between each data point in whole minutes, from 1 to 60 minutes. Acceptable formats include ISO 8601 timedeltas, strings formatted like HH:MM, and integers/float assumed as seconds.

timezone.title: Timezone
timezone.description: Timezone data will be converted to before computation. Unlocalized data will be localized to this timezone. If timezone is null, the timezone will be inferred from start/end.

JobTimeindex.description:
Parameters for a time index that all data uploads must conform to.
Data is assumed to time-averaged and closed and labeled at the left endpoint, i.e.
a datapoint at 23:00 of data with a 1 hour time step is assumed be the
average of data from 23:00 to 23:59.

gamma_pdc.description: Temperature coefficient of power in units of %/C. Typically -0.2 to -0.5 % per degree C

PVsystModuleParameters.title: PVsystModuleParameters

alpha_sc.title: Alpha Sc
alpha_sc.description: Short-circuit current temperature coefficient of the module in units of A/C

mu_gamma.title: Mu Gamma
mu_gamma.description: Temperature coefficient for the diode ideality factor, 1/K

I_L_ref.title: I L Ref
I_L_ref.description: Light-generated current (or photocurrent) at reference conditions,in amperes

I_o_ref.title: I O Ref
I_o_ref.description: Dark or diode reverse saturation current at reference conditions,in amperes

R_sh_ref.title: R Sh Ref
R_sh_ref.description: Shunt resistance at reference conditions, in ohms

R_sh_0.title: R Sh 0
R_sh_0.description: Shunt resistance at zero irradiance conditions, in ohms

R_s.title: R S
R_s.description: Series resistance at reference conditions, in ohms

cells_in_series.title: Cells In Series
cells_in_series.description: Number of cells connected in series in a module

R_sh_exp.title: R Sh Exp
R_sh_exp.description: Exponent in the equation for shunt resistance, unitless

EgRef.title: Egref
EgRef.description: Energy bandgap at reference temperature in units of eV. 1.121 eV for crystsalline silicon.

PVsystModuleParameters.description: Parameters for the modules that make up an array in a PVsyst-like model

eta_m.title: Eta M

SandiaInverterParameters.title: SandiaInverterParameters

Paco.title: Paco
Paco.description: AC power rating of the inverter, W

Pdco.title: Pdco
Pdco.description: DC power which produces the rated AC output power at the nominal DC voltage of the inverter, W

Vdco.title: Vdco
Vdco.description: Nominal DC voltage at which the AC power rating is determined, V

Pso.title: Pso
Pso.description: DC power required to start the inversion process, assumed equal to self consumption by the inverter, W

C0.title: C0
C0.description: Parameter defining the curvature of the relationship between AC power and DC power at reference operating conditions, 1/W

C1.title: C1
C1.description: Empirical coefficient allowing Pdco to vary linearly with DC voltage input, 1/V

C2.title: C2
C2.description: Empirical coefficient allowing Pso to vary linearly with DC voltage input, 1/V

C3.title: C3
C3.description: Empirical coefficient allowing C0 to vary linearly with DC voltage input, 1/V

Pnt.title: Pnt
Pnt.description: AC power consumed by the inverter when no AC power is exported  (i.e., night tare), W

SandiaInverterParameters.description:
DC-AC power conversion parameters of an inverter for Sandia's
Grid-Connected PV Inverter model
